properties.Title: Update: High Water Advisory Alert Issued For The Red River From Lockport To Netley Creek
properties.Summary:
Description: Update: This is a Manitoba Emergency Alert. Manitoba Infrastructure's Hydrologic Forecast Centre has issued a High Water Advisory for the Red River from Lockport to PTH 4 North of Selkirk due to expected high flows. If you are in the affected area, be watchful of local waterways as flooding is likely to occur. Do not attempt to cross fast flowing waters or waters of unknown depth. Avoid flooded areas. Follow all directions by the local authorities. Listen for updates and take all necessary precautions to stay safe. Up-to-date information is available at www.gov.mb.ca/flooding and www.manitoba511.ca. Follow @MBGov and @MBGovRoads on Twitter or stay tuned to local media.
Expires: 2020-04-19T11:30:00-05:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Manitoba Emergency Measures Organization, 2020-04-18T11:39:52-05:00, 0CCAB0DC-128E-9D5E-0213-245943E6AFBB
Area: Red River from Lockport to Netley Creek
properties.Author: Manitoba Emergency Measures Organization

properties.Title: Update: Flood Warning Continued For The Red River From Emerson To The Red River Floodway Inlet Control Structure
properties.Summary:
Description: Update: This is a Manitoba Emergency Alert. Manitoba Infrastructure's Hydrologic Forecast Centre has issued a Flood Warning on the Red River from Emerson to the Red River Floodway Inlet Control Structure due to high water flows. If you are in the affected area, be watchful of local waterways as flooding is likely to occur. Do not attempt to cross fast flowing waters or waters of unknown depth. Avoid flooded areas. Follow all directions given by local authorities. Listen for updates and take all necessary precautions to stay safe. Up-to-date information is available at www.gov.mb.ca/flooding and www.manitoba511.ca. Follow @MBGov and @MBGovRoads on Twitter or stay tuned to local media.
Expires: 2020-04-19T11:30:00-05:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Manitoba Emergency Measures Organization, 2020-04-18T11:40:39-05:00, 565C4D4F-EABF-90AE-78A5-6C75821EAA27
Area: Red River from Emerson to the Red River Floodway Inlet Control Structure
properties.Author: Manitoba Emergency Measures Organization

properties.Title: Special Weather Statement In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Significant snow and wind is expected. Total snowfall: 20 to 30 cm. Maximum wind gusts: 80 km/h. Locations: northeastern Newfoundland Time span: Sunday afternoon through to Monday morning. Remarks: Snow is expected to begin near noon Sunday. Snow may mix with or change to rain Sunday night, which would lower snowfall totals over some areas. Strong easterly winds will also develop Sunday, with strongest gusts expected along the coast. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NLstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NLwx.
Expires: 2020-04-19T05:17:31-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-04-18T13:18:31-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3644243778.2020
Area: Grand Falls-Windsor and vicinity, Bay of Exploits, Bonavista North, Gander and vicinity
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Flash Freeze Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Precipitation will begin as rain this evening and change to snow late this evening or overnight. Temperatures could drop rapidly overnight tonight. Water pooling, waterlogged snow and others forms of precipitation will freeze as temperatures drop. ### Surfaces such as highways, roads, walkways and parking lots may become icy and slippery. Flash freeze warnings are issued when a rapid drop in temperature is expected, that can cause water from rain or melted snow on streets and sidewalks to quickly freeze. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to QCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #QCStorm.
Expires: 2020-04-19T04:37:58-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-04-18T19:38:58-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3229005342.2020

properties.Title: Update - Precautionary Drinking Water Advisory Is Being Issued By La Plonge Reserve
properties.Summary:
Description: A Precautionary Drinking Water Advisory has been issued for La Plonge. This advisory has been extended, and is for the entire community and for any individuals who may access water from the La Plonge water system. This advisory is in effect until further notice.

properties.Title: Winter Storm Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Hazardous winter conditions are expected. Total snowfall: 20 to 30 cm and possibly higher. Maximum wind gusts: 90 km/h. Locations: Cape Breton County and Richmond County. Time span: near midnight tonight until Sunday afternoon. Remarks: Snow and blowing snow will begin near midnight tonight and into Sunday. Snow is expected to end Sunday afternoon. Strong northeasterly winds with gusts up to 90 km/h are also expected on Sunday. ### Visibility may be suddenly reduced at times in heavy snow. Winter storm warnings are issued when multiple types of severe winter weather are expected to occur together. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NSstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NSStorm.
Expires: 2020-04-19T10:38:05-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-04-18T18:39:05-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1990777928.2020
Area: Richmond County, Sydney Metro and Cape Breton County
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Snowfall Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: A long period of snowfall with total amounts of 25 to 30 cm is expected. Moisture streaming eastward across the northern Yukon is generating snow at times heavy to the northern sections of the Dempster region. Areas near the Richardson Mountains will see between 25 and 35 cm of snowfall accumulations from this afternoon through Sunday night. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather in British Columbia or Yukon, send an email to BCstorm@canada.ca or YTstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #BCStorm or #YTStorm.
Expires: 2020-04-19T14:54:41-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-04-18T22:55:41-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3901410895.2020
Area: Dempster
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Special Weather Statement In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Snow and strong winds expected tonight into Sunday. Total snowfall: 10 cm and possibly higher. Maximum wind gusts: 70 to 80 km/h. Time span: tonight to Sunday afternoon. Remarks: A low pressure system south of Nova Scotia will rapidly intensify as it tracks south of Cape Breton on Sunday. Snow and strong gusty winds can be expected with this system. Snow is forecast to begin tonight and end Sunday afternoon. There is still uncertainty with the track of the system which will affect the snowfall accumulations. If the track is closer to shore then snowfall amounts could be greater and warnings may be required. Winter storm warnings and snowfall warnings are in effect for most of Cape Breton. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NSstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NSStorm.
Expires: 2020-04-19T10:38:00-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-04-18T18:39:00-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.2138198409.2020
Area: Guysborough County, Antigonish County, Inverness County - Mabou and north
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Blizzard Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Blizzard conditions with poor visibility in snow and blowing snow are expected or occurring. Blizzard conditions in Gjoa Haven are expected to persist intermittently until this evening. ### Travel is expected to be hazardous due to reduced visibility. Blizzard warnings are issued when widespread reduced visibilities of 400 metres or less are expected for at least 6 hours. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NUstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NUStorm.
Expires: 2020-04-19T02:59:04-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-04-18T19:27:04-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3486030360.2020
Area: Gjoa Haven

properties.Title: Snowfall Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Locations: southern, eastern, northeastern and central Newfoundland as well as the Great Northern Peninsula. Total snowfall: 15 to 25 cm except 25 to 35 cm over the Baie Verte Peninsula. Time span: Sunday morning to Sunday evening for southern and eastern Newfoundland. Sunday afternoon to overnight Sunday night for central and northeastern Newfoundland. Sunday evening to Monday morning for the Great Northern Peninsula. Remarks: The snow is forecast to change to rain over the Connaigre Peninsula and from Terra Nova Park eastward to Bonavista and Clarenville Sunday evening before ending. Rainfall amounts of 10 to 15 mm are possible. ### Rapidly accumulating snow will make travel difficult. Surfaces such as highways, roads, walkways and parking lots may become difficult to navigate due to accumulating snow. Snowfall warnings are issued when significant snowfall is expected. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NLstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NLwx.
Expires: 2020-04-19T10:20:04-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-04-18T18:21:04-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1427156419.2020

properties.Title: Alberta Emergency Alert: Flood Advisory Updated
properties.Summary:
Description: A Flood Advisory has now been issued by the Alberta River Forecast Centre for Lac Ste. Anne County. Rapid snow melt has resulted in a very rapid rise in the water levels of both the Little Paddle and Paddle Rivers. Paddle River dykes are over topping in areas. This is in addition to the Spring Runoff Advisory for overland flooding in other areas of Lac Ste. Anne County. ### Residents and the travelling public may encounter high water levels in roadside ditches, and water encroaching or crossing roadways. The County has been actively steaming blocked culverts, and continues to respond to other areas of concern, to assist in the release of water to reduce hazardous conditions and prevent damage to roadway infrastructure as quickly as possible. Residents along the Little Paddle and Paddle Rivers will see additional overland flooding of low lying areas as large amounts of snow still remains in the western and northern portions of these river basins. Agricultural operations should consider moving livestock and equipment to higher ground at this time.
Expires: 2020-04-25T14:50:08-06:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Lac Ste. Anne County, 2020-04-18T14:48:52-06:00, NAADS-CA-AB-AEA1-6313
Area: Lac Ste. Anne County
properties.Author: Lac Ste. Anne County
